oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertisement from Nashville City Directory, 1871
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement of the Nashville & Chattanooga Railroad, published in the 1871 Nashville City Directory. It states: “Through tickets and baggage checks can be had to principal points at Maxwell House, Church St., and at Depot, Church Street. W. L. Danley, General Pass. And Ticket Agt. (N. & C. and N. & N. W. R. R.); J. W. Thomas, Gen. Superintendent.” The Nashville and Chattanooga Railroad (N&C) created new towns and a new corporate landscape as it brought the industrial age to Middle Tennessee. The railroad was the first complete line to operate in Tennessee in 1854. Forms part of Nashville City Directory Collection, Metro Archives. 1 digital image.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville & Chattanooga Railroad Company
